info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 24 at 3:58AM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTHWESTERN LITTLE RIVER... SOUTHWESTERN SEVIER...SOUTHEASTERN MCCURTAIN AND NORTHWESTERN BOWIE COUNTIES THROUGH 430 AM CDT... At 358 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles southeast of Broken Bow, or 16 miles west of Horatio, moving southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Horatio, Foreman, Idabel, Broken Bow, Winthrop, Arkinda, Haworth, Bokhoma, Eagletown, Almont, Moon, Cerrogordo, Beaverdams, Goodlake, Harris, Goodwater, Shinewell, Tom, America, and West Line. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 600 AM CDT for southwestern Arkansas...southeastern Oklahoma...and northeastern Texas.
